description.narrative: (Bangladesh): USAID will invest FY 2016 funds in Sisimpur (the Bangladeshi version of Sesame Street), an educational television broadcast that reaches 12 million households weekly. As the most widely viewed children's television program in Bangladesh, the activity targets young children and their parents with content on health, nutrition, safety, the environment, gender equity, and social responsibility, in addition to lessons on literacy and numeracy. It thus reinforces the work of other Mission programs such as the Feed the Future and the Global Health Initiative while directly preparing pre-schoolers for school and fortifying the basic skills in children in early grades. The activity will continue to build the capacity of Sesame Workshop's branch in Bangladesh to independently manage, produce, and broadcast Sisimpur shows.
